TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IScrollProvider

Docs.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to a control that acts as a scrollable container for a collection of child objects. The children of this control must implement .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Implemented on a UI Automation provider that must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern> control pattern.

Docs.related: Support Control Patterns in a UI Automation Provider
Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern

MemberSignature.Value: public bool HorizontallyScrollable { get; }
.property instance bool HorizontallyScrollable
Public ReadOnly Property HorizontallyScrollable As Boolean
public: property bool HorizontallyScrollable { bool get(); };
member this.HorizontallyScrollable : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll horizontally.
Docs.value: if the control can scroll horizontally; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be dynamic. For example, the content area of the control might not be larger than the current viewable area, meaning <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontallyScrollable%2A> is `false`. However, either resizing the control or adding child items can increase the bounds of the content area beyond the viewable area, meaning that <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontallyScrollable%2A> is `true`.

Docs.related: Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern

MemberSignature.Value: public double HorizontalScrollPercent { get; }
.property instance float64 HorizontalScrollPercent
Public ReadOnly Property HorizontalScrollPercent As Double
public: property double HorizontalScrollPercent { double get(); };
member this.HorizontalScrollPercent : double

Docs.summary: Gets the current horizontal scroll position.
Docs.value: The horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
Docs.related: Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern

MemberSignature.Value: public double HorizontalViewSize { get; }
.property instance float64 HorizontalViewSize
Public ReadOnly Property HorizontalViewSize As Double
public: property double HorizontalViewSize { double get(); };
member this.HorizontalViewSize : double

Docs.summary: Gets the current horizontal view size.
Docs.value: The horizontal size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
Docs.related: Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern

MemberSignature.Value: public void Scroll (System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount horizontalAmount, System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount verticalAmount);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Scroll(valuetype System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount horizontalAmount, valuetype System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount verticalAmount) cil managed
Public Sub Scroll (horizontalAmount As ScrollAmount, verticalAmount As ScrollAmount)
public: void Scroll(System::Windows::Automation::ScrollAmount horizontalAmount, System::Windows::Automation::ScrollAmount verticalAmount);
abstract member Scroll : System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount * System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount -> unit

Docs.param: The horizontal increment specific to the control. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical increment specific to the control. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
Docs.summary: Scrolls the visible region of the content area horizontally and vertically.
Docs.exception: If a control supports values exclusively for horizontal or vertical scrolling but a value is passed in.
An attempt is made to scroll in an unsupported direction.
Docs.related: Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetScrollPercent (double horizontalPercent, double verticalPercent);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetScrollPercent(float64 horizontalPercent, float64 verticalPercent) cil managed
Public Sub SetScrollPercent (horizontalPercent As Double, verticalPercent As Double)
public: void SetScrollPercent(double horizontalPercent, double verticalPercent);
abstract member SetScrollPercent : double * double -> unit

Docs.param: The horizontal position as a percentage of the content area's total range. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical position as a percentage of the content area's total range. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
Docs.summary: Sets the horizontal and vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is only useful when the content area of the control is larger than the visible region.
Passing in the value <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll> indicates that there is no scrolling in the specified direction.

Docs.exception: A value that cannot be converted to a double is passed in.
A value greater than 100 or less than 0 is passed in (except -1, which is equivalent to ). The and values are normalized to either 100 percent or 0 percent.
An attempt is made to scroll in an unsupported direction.
Docs.related: Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern

Public ReadOnly Property VerticallyScrollable As Boolean
public: property bool VerticallyScrollable { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll vertically.
Docs.value: if the control can scroll vertically; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be dynamic. For example, the content area of the control might not be larger than the viewable area meaning <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticallyScrollable%2A> is `false`. However, resizing the control or adding child items can increase the bounds of the content area beyond the viewable area, indicating that <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticallyScrollable%2A> is `true`.

Docs.related: Implementing the UI Automation Scroll Control Pattern
